intro: Homalobus detritalis, commonly known as the detrital homalobus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
